<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-
COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center">
<IMG SRC="g206461g61u98.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center">
<IMG SRC="g206461g28b94.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>MERGER PROPOSAL&#151;YOUR VOTE IS VERY
IMPORTANT </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><center> <P 
STYLE="line-height:6.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt 
solid #000000;width:21%">&nbsp;</P></center>
<P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Mines Management, Inc., an Idaho corporation (&#147;Mines 
Management&#148;), Hecla Mining Company, a Delaware corporation 
(&#147;Hecla&#148;), and HL Idaho
Corp., an Idaho corporation and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla (&#147;Merger
Sub&#148;), have entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of 
May&nbsp;23, 2016, as amended on June 29, 2016 and July 29, 2016 (as amended and
as it may be
further amended from time to time, the &#147;merger agreement&#148;) pursuant to
which Merger Sub will merge with and into Mines Management with Mines Management
surviving the merger as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla (the 
&#147;merger&#148;).
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">If the merger is completed, Mines Management 
stockholders will have the right to receive 0.2218 of a share of Hecla common 
stock for each share of Mines
Management common stock.&nbsp;Any stockholders entitled to receive a fractional 
share of Hecla common stock shall receive cash in lieu of such fractional share.
This exchange ratio is fixed and will not be adjusted to reflect stock price 
changes
prior to the closing of the merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Based on the estimated 
number of shares of Mines Management common stock outstanding on the record date
for the special
meeting of Mines Management stockholders, Hecla expects to issue approximately 
9,024,790 shares of Hecla common stock to Mines Management stockholders in the 
merger. Upon completion of the transaction, it is projected that holders of 
Mines
Management common stock will own approximately 2.28% of Hecla&#146;s outstanding
common stock, while existing stockholders of Hecla will continue to own the 
remaining 97.72%. Mines Management common stock is currently listed for trading 
on the NYSE
MKT LLC under the symbol &#147;MGN&#148; and the Toronto Stock Exchange under 
the symbol &#147;MGT.&#148; Following completion of the merger, Hecla common 
stock will continue to trade on the NYSE under the symbol &#147;HL&#148; and 
Mines Management
common stock will cease to be listed for trading. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management 
will hold a special meeting of its stockholders on September 12, 2016 in 
conjunction
with the proposed merger. Hecla&#146;s stockholders are not required to approve 
the proposed merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">At the special meeting of Mines 
Management
stockholders, Mines Management stockholders will be asked to consider and vote 
on (i)&nbsp;a proposal to approve and adopt the merger agreement (the 
&#147;merger proposal&#148;), (ii)&nbsp;a proposal to adjourn the special
meeting, if necessary or
appropriate, including to solicit additional proxies if there are not sufficient
votes to approve and adopt the merger proposal (the &#147;adjournment 
proposal&#148;) and (iii)&nbsp;a non-binding, advisory proposal to approve the 
compensation that
may become payable to Mines Management&#146;s named executive officers in 
connection with the merger (the &#147;compensation proposal&#148;). Approval and
adoption of the merger proposal, the adjournment proposal and the compensation 
proposal each
requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by holders of 
Mines Management common stock present in person or represented by proxy at the 
special meeting and entitled to vote on the matter, and a quorum must be present
at the
special meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management cannot complete the 
merger unless its stockholders approve and adopt the merger proposal. <B>Your 
vote is very important,
regardless of the number of shares you own. Whether or not you expect to attend 
the special meeting in person, please submit a proxy as promptly as possible by 
(1)</B><B>&nbsp;</B><B>accessing the Internet website specified on your proxy 
card,
(2)</B><B>&nbsp;</B><B>calling the toll-free number specified on your proxy card
or (3)</B><B>&nbsp;</B><B>marking, signing, dating and returning all proxy cards
that you receive in the postage-paid envelope provided, so that your shares may 
be
represented and voted at the special meeting.</B> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>After careful 
consideration, the Mines Management board of directors, on May 21, 2016, 
unanimously
approved, adopted and declared advisable the merger agreement and the merger, 
directed that the merger agreement be submitted to the stockholders of Mines 
Management for approval and adoption and determined that the terms of the merger
agreement and
the merger are advisable and in the best interests of Mines Management&#146;s 
stockholders. The Mines Management board of directors accordingly unanimously 
recommends that the Mines Management stockholders vote &#147;FOR&#148; each of 
the merger
proposal, the adjournment proposal and the compensation proposal. </B></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">The obligations of Mines Management and Hecla to complete the 
transactions are
subject to the satisfaction or waiver of several conditions set forth in the 
merger agreement. More information about Mines Management, Hecla and the merger 
is contained in this proxy statement/prospectus. <B>Mines Management</B> <B>and 
Hecla
encourage you to read this entire proxy statement/prospectus carefully, 
including the section entitled &#147;<A HREF="#toc206461_27">Risk 
Factors</A>&#148; beginning on page </B><B>24</B><B>, as well as the information
incorporated herein by
reference.</B> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">We look forward to the successful completion of the
merger. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Sincerely, </P> <P STYLE="font-size:5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Glenn M. Dobbs<I></I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;

Executive
Officer</I></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>Neither the Securities and Exchange Commission nor 
any state securities commission has approved or disapproved of the
securities to be issued under this proxy statement/prospectus or determined that
this proxy statement/prospectus is accurate or complete. Any representation to 
the contrary is a criminal offense. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>This proxy statement/prospectus is dated August 10, 2016 and is 
first being mailed to the stockholders of Mines Management on or about August 
10, 2016.

<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Dear Stockholder of Mines Management, Inc.: </P> <P STYLE="margin-

pleased to
invite you to attend the special meeting of stockholders of Mines Management, 
Inc., an Idaho corporation (&#147;Mines Management&#148;), which will be held at
the Lincoln Building, 811 W. Riverside,
2<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">nd</SUP> floor conference room, 
Spokane, Washington 99201, on Monday, September 12, 2016, at 2:00 p.m., local 
time, for the following purposes: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">to consider and vote on a proposal to approve and 
adopt the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of May 23, 2016, by and among 
Mines Management, Hecla Mining Company, a Delaware corporation 
(&#147;Hecla&#148;), and HL
Idaho Corp., an Idaho corporation and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla 
(&#147;Merger Sub&#148;), as amended on June 29, 2016 and July 29, 2016 and as 
it may be further amended from time to time, a copy of which is included as 
Appendix A to the
proxy statement/prospectus accompanying this notice, pursuant to which Merger 
Sub will be merged with and into Mines Management (with Mines Management 
surviving the merger as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla) and each outstanding
share of common
stock of Mines Management (other than shares owned by Mines Management, Hecla or
Merger Sub, which will be cancelled) will be converted into the right to receive
0.2218 of a share of common stock of Hecla (the &#147;merger proposal&#148;), 
with
fractional shares being paid in cash; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">to consider and vote on a proposal to adjourn the 
special meeting, if necessary or appropriate, including to solicit additional 
proxies if there are not sufficient votes to approve and adopt the merger 
proposal (the
&#147;adjournment proposal&#148;); and </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mines 
Management will transact no other business at the special meeting except such 
business as may be
brought at the direction of the Mines Management board of directors. Please 
refer to the attached proxy statement/prospectus for further information with 
respect to the business to be transacted at the special meeting. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">The Mines Management board of directors has fixed the close of 
business on July 5, 2016 as the record date for determination of Mines 
Management stockholders
entitled to receive notice of, and to vote at, the special meeting or any 
adjournments or postponements thereof. Only stockholders of record of Mines 
Management at the close of business on the record date are entitled to notice 
of, and to vote at,
the special meeting and at any adjournment or postponement of the special 
meeting. A list of stockholders of record entitled to vote at the special 
meeting will be available for inspection by stockholders for any purpose germane
to the special
meeting at Mines Management&#146;s executive offices and principal place of 
business at 905 West Riverside Avenue, Suite 311, Spokane, Washington 99201 
during ordinary business hours for a period of ten days before the special 
meeting. The list will
also be available at the special meeting for examination by any stockholder of 
record present at the special meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Approval and adoption 
of the merger
proposal, the adjournment proposal and the compensation proposal each requires
the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by holders of Mines 
Management common stock present in person or represented by proxy at the special
meeting and
entitled to vote on the proposal, and a quorum must be present at the special 
meeting.<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"> </SUP>Certain 
stockholders of Mines Management have entered into shareholders agreements, each
dated May&nbsp;23,
2016, pursuant to which each such stockholder has agreed, among other things, to
vote its shares of Mines Management common stock in favor of the approval and 
adoption of the </P>

common stock (which include 1,322,621 shares of Mines Management common stock

entitled to
dissenters&#146; or appraisal rights. </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-

nominee,
please follow the instructions on the voting instruction card furnished to you 
by such record holder.<B>&nbsp;</B> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ABOUT THIS DOCUMENT </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">This document, which forms part of a registration statement on Form 
S-4 filed with the SEC by Hecla (File No.&nbsp;333-212313) (the 
&#147;registration
statement&#148;), constitutes a prospectus of Hecla under Section&nbsp;5 of the 
Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#147;Securities Act&#148;), with 
respect to the shares of Hecla common stock to be issued pursuant to the 
Agreement and Plan of
Merger, dated as of May 23, 2016, by and among Hecla, Merger Sub and Mines 
Management, as amended on June 29, 2016 and July 29, 2016 and as it may be 
further amended from time to time. This document also constitutes a notice of 
meeting and a proxy
statement under Section&nbsp;14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as 
amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), with respect to the special meeting of 
Mines Management stockholders, at which Mines Management stockholders will be 
asked to
consider and vote on, among other matters, a proposal to approve and adopt the 
merger agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman">You should
rely only on the information contained in or incorporated by reference into this
proxy statement/prospectus. No one has been authorized to provide you with 
information that is different from that contained in, or incorporated by 
reference into, this
proxy statement/prospectus. This proxy statement/prospectus is dated 
August&nbsp;10, 2016. The information contained in this proxy 
statement/prospectus is accurate only as of that date or, in the case of 
information in a document incorporated by
reference, as of the date of such document, unless the information specifically 
indicates that another date applies. Neither the mailing of this proxy 
statement/prospectus to Mines Management stockholders nor the issuance by Hecla 
of its common
stock pursuant to the merger agreement will create any implication to the 
contrary. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">This proxy statement/prospectus does not constitute
an offer to sell,
or a solicitation of an offer to buy, any securities, or the solicitation of a 
proxy, in any jurisdiction in which, or from any person to whom, it is unlawful 
to make any such offer or solicitation in such jurisdiction. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">The information concerning Hecla contained in this proxy 
statement/prospectus or incorporated by reference has been provided by Hecla, 
and the information
concerning Mines Management contained in this proxy statement/prospectus has 
been provided by Mines Management. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Unless otherwise 
indicated or as the
context otherwise requires, all references in this proxy statement/prospectus 
to: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

and Plan of Merger, dated May 23, 2016, among Mines Management, Hecla and Merger

time to time, a copy of which is included as Appendix A in this proxy

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;merger consideration&#148; means 0.2218 
shares of Hecla common stock per share of Mines Management common stock; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Merger Sub&#148; means HL Idaho Corp., an 
Idaho corporation and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Mines Management&#148; means Mines 
Management, Inc., an Idaho corporation; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Mines Management common stock&#148; means 
the common stock, par value $0.001 per share, of Mines Management; 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Montanore&#148; or &#147;Montanore 
Project&#148; means the proposed exploration and development by Mines Management
and its subsidiaries of mineral deposits located on the patented and unpatented 
mining claims,
millsites and tunnel sites owned by Mines Management or one of its subsidiaries 
located in Sanders and Lincoln Counties in northwest Montana; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;spot premium&#148; means the premium paid by
an acquirer above the last closing price of the common stock of an acquired 
company immediately prior to the public announcement of the acquisition 
transaction;
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;surviving company&#148; means Mines 
Management following completion of the merger; and </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;shareholder&#148; and 
&#147;stockholder&#148; shall be used interchangeably herein. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">In addition, unless
otherwise indicated or as the context otherwise requires, all references in this
proxy statement/prospectus to: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Guide 7 Definitions 
</U></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;mineralized material&#148; means material 
that is not included in reserves as it does not meet all of the criteria for 
adequate demonstration of economic or legal extraction; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;reserves&#148; means that part of a mineral 
deposit which could be economically and legally extracted or produced; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;exploration stage&#148; means a prospect 
which is not in either the development or production stage; </TD></TR></TABLE> 
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;development stage&#148; means a prospect 
which is undergoing preparation of an established commercially mineable deposit 
(reserve) for its extraction but which is not yet in production. This stage 
occurs after
completion of a feasibility study; and </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;production stage&#148; means a project 
actively engaged in the exploitation of a mineral deposit (reserve). 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><U>Additional Definitions </U></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-
top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;adit&#148; means a horizontal tunnel or 
drive, open to the surface at one end, which is used as an entrance to a mine; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;axis&#148; means an intersection of the 
axial plane of a fold with a particular bed; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;bankable feasibility study&#148; means a 
comprehensive study of a mineral deposit in which all geological, engineering, 
legal, operating, economic, social, environmental and other relevant factors are
considered
in sufficient detail that it could reasonably serve as the basis for a final 
decision by a financial institution to finance the development of the deposit 
for mineral production; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;bornite&#148; means an isometric mineral, 
1[Cu5 FeS4]; metallic; brownish bronze tarnishing to iridescent blue and purple;
in hypogene and contact metamorphic deposits and mafic rocks; a valuable source 
of copper;
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;chalcocite&#148; means a monoclinic mineral,
96[Cu2 S]; pseudohexagonal, metallic gray black with blue to green tarnish; a 
secondary vein mineral; an important source of copper; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;development&#148; means, with respect to a 
mineral deposit or project, work carried out for the purpose of opening up a 
mineral deposit and making the actual ore extraction possible; 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;dip&#148; means the angle at which a vein, 
structure or rock bed is inclined from the horizontal as measured at right 
angles to the strike; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;drift&#148; means a horizontal underground 
opening that follows along the length of a vein or rock formation as opposed to 
a cross cut which crosses the rock formation; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;exploration&#148; means work involved in 
searching for ore, usually by drilling or driving a drift; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;galena&#148; means a sulfide mineral of 
lead, being a common lead ore mineral; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;General Mining Law&#148; means the General 
Mining Law of 1872; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-
top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;grade&#148; means the average assay of a ton
of ore, reflecting metal content; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;horizon&#148; means, in geology, any given 
definite position or interval in the stratigraphic column or the scheme of 
stratigraphic classification; generally used in a relative sense; 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;indicated mineral resource&#148; refers to 
that part of a mineral resource for which quantity, grade or quality, densities,
shape and physical characteristics can be estimated with a level of confidence 
sufficient
to allow the appropriate application of technical and economic parameters, to 
support mine planning and evaluation of the economic viability of the deposit. 
The estimate is based on detailed and reliable exploration and testing 
information gathered
through appropriate techniques from locations such as outcrops, trenches, pits, 
workings and drill holes that are spaced closely enough for geological and grade
continuity to be reasonably assumed; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;inferred resource&#148; means the part of a 
mineral resource for which quantity and grade or quality can be estimated on the
basis of geological evidence and limited sampling and reasonably assumed, but 
not
verified, geological and grade continuity. The estimate is based on limited 
information and sampling gathered through appropriate techniques from locations 
such as outcrops, trenches, pits, workings and drill holes; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;interbed&#148; means occurring between 
distinct rock layers or strata; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;lode&#148; means a vein of mineral ore 
deposited between clearly demarcated layers of rock; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;measured mineral resource&#148; refers to 
that part of a mineral resource for which quantity, grade or quality, densities,
shape and physical characteristics are so well established that they can be 
estimated with
confidence sufficient to allow the appropriate application of technical and 
economic parameters, to support production planning and evaluation of the 
economic viability of the deposit. The estimate is based on detailed and 
reliable exploration,
sampling and testing information gathered through appropriate techniques from 
locations such as outcrops, trenches, pits, workings and drill holes that are 
spaced closely enough to confirm both geological and grade continuity; 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;metasediment&#148; means a sedimentary rock 
which shows evidence of having been subjected to metamorphism; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;mineral&#148; means a naturally occurring 
homogeneous substance having definite physical properties and chemical 
composition and, if formed under favorable conditions, a definite crystal form; 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;mineralization&#148; means the presence of 
economic minerals in a specific area or geological formation; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;National Instrument 43-101&#148; means the 
standards of disclosure for mineral projects prescribed by the Canadian 
Securities Administrators; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;ore&#148; means material that can be mined 
and processed that provides a positive cash flow; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;patented mining claim&#148; means a mining 
claim for which the federal government of the United States has passed its title
to the claimant, making it private land. A person may mine and remove minerals 
from a
mining claim without a mineral patent. However, a mineral patent gives the owner
exclusive title to the locatable minerals. It also gives the owner title to the 
surface and other resources; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;precambrian&#148; means all geologic time 
before the Paleozoic era; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-
top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;prospect&#148; means a mining property, the 
value of which has not been determined by exploration; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;quartzite&#148; means a metamorphic rock 
formed by the transformation of a sandstone rock by heat and pressure; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;reclamation&#148; means the restoration of a
site after mining or exploration activity is completed; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">&#147;siltite&#148; 
means an indurated silt having the texture and composition of shale but lacking 
its fine
lamination or fissility; a massive mudstone in which the silt predominates over 
clay; a nonfissile silt </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
shale. It tends to be flaggy, containing hard, durable, generally thin layers, 
and often showing various primary current structures; </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;strike&#148; means the direction, or bearing
from true north, of a vein or rock formation measured on a horizontal surface; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;sulfide&#148; means a compound of bivalent 
sulfur with an electropositive element or group, especially a binary compound of
sulfur with a metal; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;tailings&#148; means material rejected from 
a mill after the recoverable valuable minerals have been extracted; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;unpatented mining claim&#148; means a parcel
of property located on federal lands pursuant to the General Mining Law and the 
requirements of the state in which the unpatented claim is located, the 
paramount title
of which remains with the federal government of the United States. The holder of
a valid, unpatented lode mining claim is granted certain rights including the 
right to explore and mine such claim under the General Mining Law; and 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;vein&#148; means a mineralized zone having a
more or less regular development in length, width and depth, which clearly 
separates it from neighboring rock. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><A HREF="#toc206461_71">PROPOSAL 3: ADVISORY (NON-BINDING) VOTE ON 
COMPENSATION</A></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
