 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">ii </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><A NAME="toc206461_1"></A>QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I>Set forth below are questions that you, as a stockholder of Mines 
Management, may have regarding the merger, the adjournment proposal, the 
compensation
proposal and the special meeting, and brief answers to those questions. You are 
urged to read carefully this proxy statement/prospectus and the other documents 
referred to in this proxy statement/prospectus in their entirety, including the 
merger
agreement, which is attached as Appendix A to this proxy statement/prospectus, 
and the documents incorporated by reference into this proxy 
statement/prospectus, because this section may not provide all of the 
information that is important to you
with respect to the merger and the special meeting. You may obtain a list of the
documents incorporated by reference into this proxy statement/prospectus in the 
section titled &#147;Where You Can Find More Information&#148; beginning on
page&nbsp;108. </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Why am I receiving this proxy 
statement/prospectus? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Mines Management and Hecla have agreed to a merger, 
pursuant to which Mines Management will merge with Merger Sub, a wholly-owned 
subsidiary of
Hecla. Mines Management will continue its existence as the surviving entity and 
become a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla, but will cease to be a publicly 
traded company. This transaction is sometimes referred to throughout this proxy
statement/prospectus as the &#147;merger.&#148; Please see &#147;Proposal 1: The
Approval and Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;Effects of the Merger&#148; 
on page&nbsp;41 of this proxy statement/prospectus and &#147;Proposal 1: The 
Approval and
Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;The Merger Agreement&#148; on page 67 of 
this proxy statement/prospectus. A copy of the merger agreement is attached to
this proxy statement/prospectus as Appendix A. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">In order to complete the merger, Mines Management stockholders must 
vote to approve and adopt the merger agreement. Mines Management is holding a 
special
meeting of its stockholders to obtain such stockholder approval and adoption. 
Mines Management stockholders will also be asked to approve, on an advisory 
(non-binding) basis, the payments that will or may be paid by Mines Management 
to its named
executive officers in connection with the merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In the
merger, Hecla will issue shares of its common stock as the consideration to be 
paid to holders
of Mines Management common stock. This document is being delivered to you as 
both a proxy statement of Mines Management and a prospectus of Hecla in 
connection with the merger. It is the proxy statement by which the board of 
directors of Mines
Management is soliciting proxies from you to vote on the approval and adoption 
of the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby at the special
meeting or at any adjournment or postponement of the special meeting. It is also
the
prospectus by which Hecla is offering the shares of Hecla common stock it will 
issue to you in the merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: How does the board of 
directors of Mines
Management recommend that its stockholders vote? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: 
</B>Mines Management&#146;s board of directors unanimously approved, adopted and
declared
advisable the merger agreement and the merger, directed that the merger 
agreement be submitted to the stockholders of Mines Management for approval and 
adoption and determined that the terms of the merger agreement and the merger 
are advisable and
in the best interests of Mines Management&#146;s stockholders. The Mines 
Management board of directors accordingly unanimously recommends that the Mines 
Management stockholders vote &#147;FOR&#148; each of the merger proposal, the 
adjournment
proposal and the compensation proposal. See &#147;Proposal 1: The Approval and 
Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;Recommendation of Mines Management&#146;s 
Board of Directors; Mines Management&#146;s Reasons for the Merger&#148; 
beginning on page
48 of this proxy statement/prospectus. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Am I being asked 
to vote on anything else? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Yes. Mines Management&#146;s board of directors is asking 
you to consider and vote on the adjournment proposal and the compensation 
proposal. See
&#147;Proposal 2: Possible Adjournment to Solicit Additional Proxies If </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">1 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
Necessary or Appropriate&#148; on page 84 of this proxy statement/prospectus and
&#147;Proposal 3: Advisory (Non-Binding) Vote on Compensation&#148; beginning on
page 85 of this proxy
statement/prospectus. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Why are Mines Management 
stockholders being asked to approve, on a non-binding advisory basis, the 
compensation that may be
paid or become payable to Mines Management&#146;s named executive officers in 
connection with the completion of the merger? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A:</B> The 
rules
promulgated by the SEC under Section&nbsp;14A of the Exchange Act require Mines 
Management to seek a non-binding, advisory vote with respect to certain 
compensation that may be paid or become payable to Mines Management&#146;s named
executive
officers in connection with the merger. For more information regarding such 
payments, see the section entitled &#147;Proposal 3: Advisory (Non-Binding) Vote
on Compensation&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;85. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What will Mines Management stockholders receive in the 
transaction? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>If the transaction is completed, holders of Mines 
Management common stock will be entitled to receive 0.2218 of a share of Hecla 
common stock for
each share of Mines Management common stock they hold at the effective time. Any
stockholders entitled to receive a fractional share of Hecla common stock shall 
receive cash in lieu of such fractional share. This exchange ratio is fixed and 
will not
be adjusted to reflect stock price changes prior to the closing of the 
merger.&nbsp;Following the completion of the merger, Mines Management common 
stock will cease to trade on the NYSE MKT LLC (&#147;NYSE MKT&#148;) and the 
Toronto Stock Exchange
(&#147;TSX&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What will happen to outstanding 
Mines Management options and warrants in the merger? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>At the effective time, each option to purchase shares of 
Mines Management<B> </B>common stock that is outstanding immediately prior to 
the effective
time that has an exercise price per share greater than or equal to the product 
of the closing price of Hecla common stock on the NYSE on the trading day 
immediately preceding the closing date and 0.2218 will be cancelled without any 
payment being
made in respect thereof. At the effective time, each other option to purchase 
shares of Mines Management common stock that is outstanding immediately prior to
the effective time (all of which are vested) will be cancelled in exchange for 
the right
to receive shares of Hecla common stock (without interest, and subject to 
deduction for any required withholding tax, with cash being paid in lieu of 
issuing fractional shares of Hecla common stock) with a value equal to (i)(a) 
the product of the
closing price of Hecla common stock on the NYSE on the trading day immediately 
preceding the closing date and 0.2218 minus (b) the exercise price per share 
under such option multiplied by (ii) the number of shares subject to such 
option. At the
option of Hecla, in lieu of paying all or a portion of the amounts due to a 
holder of options with shares of Hecla common stock, Hecla may substitute for 
such shares an equivalent amount in cash. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">At the effective time, and in accordance with the terms of any 
warrant to purchase shares of Mines Management<B> </B>common stock that is 
outstanding
immediately prior to the effective time, such warrant will either be cancelled 
in accordance with its terms or a replacement warrant will be issued giving the 
holder the right to purchase a number of shares of Hecla common stock (without 
interest,
and subject to deduction for any required withholding tax, and no issuance of
fractional shares and the number of such shares rounded down) equal to the 
product of (i)&nbsp;0.2218 and (ii)&nbsp;the number of shares of Mines 
Management common
stock<B> </B>subject to such warrant, with an exercise price of $4.8765 per 
share of Hecla common stock, pursuant to and in accordance with such 
holder&#146;s warrant (as amended). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What happens if the market price of shares of Hecla common 
stock or shares of Mines Management common stock changes before the closing of 
the merger?
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>No change will be made to the exchange ratio 
of 0.2218 if the market price of shares of Mines Management common stock or 
shares of Hecla
common stock changes before the closing of the merger. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: How will Mines Management stockholders receive the merger 
consideration to which they are entitled?
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>After receiving the proper documentation from 
you, following the effective time of the merger, the exchange agent will forward
to you (if
you are the holder of record) or to your broker, bank, trust company or other 
nominee (each, a &#147;broker&#148;) the shares of Hecla common stock and cash 
in lieu of fractional shares to which you are entitled. For additional 
information about the
exchange of Mines Management shares of common stock for Hecla shares of common 
stock, see the section entitled &#147;Proposal 1: The Approval and Adoption of 
the Merger Agreement&#151;Exchange of Shares in the Merger&#148; beginning on 
page 64. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">You do not need to take any action at this time. <B>Please do not 
send your Mines Management</B> <B>stock certificates with your proxy card.</B> 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: How does Hecla common stock differ from Mines Management common
stock? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Your rights as a Hecla stockholder will be different than 
your rights as a Mines Management stockholder. A chart comparing your rights as 
a Mines
Management stockholder to your rights as a Hecla stockholder is included in this
proxy statement/prospectus. Please see &#147;Comparative Rights of Hecla 
Stockholders and Mines Management Stockholders&#148; beginning at page 87 of 
this proxy
statement/prospectus. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Will the shares of Hecla common 
stock issued in connection with the merger be listed for trading on a stock 
exchange?
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>Hecla&#146;s outstanding common stock is 
currently listed on the New York Stock Exchange (the &#147;NYSE&#148;). Hecla 
has filed an
application to have the Hecla shares issued as part of the merger approved for 
listing on the NYSE upon notice of issuance. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: When does 
Mines
Management expect the transaction to be completed? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: 
</B>Hecla and Mines Management are working to complete the merger as quickly as 
practicable
and currently expect that it will be completed in the third quarter of 2016, 
promptly after the special meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What are the 
material U.S. federal
income tax consequences of the transaction? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>Mines 
Management is not expected to recognize any gain or loss for U.S. federal income
tax
purposes as a result of the merger. Mines Management stockholders that are U.S. 
holders are not expected to recognize any gain or loss for U.S. federal income 
tax purposes upon the merger, except for any gain or loss attributable to the 
receipt of
cash in lieu of fractional shares of Hecla common stock received in the merger. 
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">The aggregate tax basis of the Hecla common stock 
received in the merger
(including fractional shares deemed received and redeemed) will be equal to the 
aggregate adjusted tax basis of the shares of Mines Management common stock 
surrendered for the Hecla common stock, and the holding period of the Hecla 
common stock
(including fractional shares deemed received and redeemed) will include the 
period during which the shares of Mines Management common stock were held. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Mines Management has received the opinion of Davis Graham &amp; 
Stubbs LLP that the merger will qualify as a tax-free reorganization described 
in Section 368
of the United States Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the 
&#147;Code&#148;). You are encouraged to read the opinion, which is attached as 
Appendix C. In addition, you should also read the discussion in the section 
entitled &#147;Proposal
1: The Approval and Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;Material U.S. Federal 
Income Tax Consequences of the Merger&#148; on page 62 of this proxy 
statement/prospectus and consult your own tax advisors as to the U.S. federal 
income tax
consequences of the merger, as well as the effects of state, local and foreign 
tax laws. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">3 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What vote of Mines Management stockholders is required to 
approve and adopt the merger? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Approval and adoption of the merger requires the 
affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by holders of Mines Management 
common stock present
in person or represented by proxy at the special meeting and entitled to vote on
the proposal, and a quorum must be present at the special 
meeting.<B>&nbsp;</B>Only holders of record of Mines Management common stock at 
the close of business on July
5, 2016, which is referred to as the record date, are entitled to notice of and 
to vote at the special meeting. As of the record date, there were 35,857,893
shares of Mines Management common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the 
special
meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Are any stockholders already committed to 
vote in favor of the merger? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Yes. Pursuant to shareholders agreements with Hecla, Mines 
Management&#146;s stockholder Silver Wheaton Corp. and the following directors 
and
officers of Mines Management have each agreed to vote the shares of Mines 
Management common stock (as set forth in such shareholder&#146;s shareholders 
agreement) that they directly, indirectly or beneficially own or control at the 
special meeting
in favor of the merger: Glenn Dobbs, Douglas Dobbs, Nicole Altenburg, Russell 
Babcock, Roy Franklin and Robert Russell. Shares representing approximately 
17.6% of Mines Management common stock (which include 1,322,621 shares of Mines 
Management
common stock subject to currently exercisable options) are subject to the 
shareholders agreements as of the date of this proxy statement/prospectus. For a
more complete description of the Shareholders Agreements, see 
&#147;Proposal&nbsp;1: The
Approval and Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;Shareholders Agreements&#148;
beginning at page&nbsp;67 of this proxy statement/prospectus. The form of 
Shareholders Agreement is also attached to this proxy statement/prospectus as 
Appendix D. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Are there any risks to me in approving and adopting the merger?
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Yes. You should carefully review the section entitled 
&#147;Risk Factors&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;24. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What happens if the merger is not completed? </B></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>A:
</B>If the merger is not approved and adopted by the Mines Management 
stockholders or the merger does not occur for any other reason, neither Mines 
Management nor its stockholders will receive any shares of Hecla common stock. 
Instead, Mines
Management will remain an independent public company, and Mines 
Management&#146;s common stock may continue to be quoted on the NYSE MKT and 
TSX. See &#147;Risk Factors&#151;Risk Factors Relating to Mines 
Management.&#148; Further, if the merger
does not occur under specified circumstances, Mines Management may be required 
to pay Hecla a termination fee and reimburse Hecla for its expenses incurred 
under the merger agreement as described in the section entitled &#147;Proposal 
1: The
Approval and Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;The Merger 
Agreement&#151;Termination Fees and Expenses&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;81. 
Mines Management is experiencing severe financial challenges, and stockholders 
should carefully review the
discussion of such challenges set forth in &#147;Risk Factors&#151;Risk Factors 
Relating to Mines Management&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;29 and elsewhere in 
this proxy statement/prospectus. If the merger is not completed, Mines 
Management would
have to seek additional financing, which may be unavailable, or consider other 
alternatives, including a bankruptcy filing. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Am I 
entitled to
appraisal or dissenters&#146; rights? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>No. Under 
Idaho law, holders of Mines Management common stock will not be entitled to 
dissenters&#146;
or appraisal rights. Therefore, holders of Mines Management common stock as of
the record date that are against the merger may vote against approval and 
adoption of the merger agreement but may not exercise dissenters&#146; or 
appraisal rights. See
&#147;No Appraisal Rights&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;96. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman"><B>Q: When and where will the special meeting of Mines Management 
stockholders be held?
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>The special meeting of Mines Management 
stockholders will be held at the Lincoln Building, 811 W. Riverside, 2<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">nd</SUP> floor conference room, 
Spokane, Washington 99201, on Monday, September 12, 2016, at 2:00&nbsp;p.m., 
local time. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Who can attend and vote at the special meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>All Mines Management stockholders of record as of the close
of business on the record date are entitled to receive notice of, to attend and 
to vote
at the special meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: How can I attend the special 
meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>All of Mines Management&#146;s stockholders are invited to 
attend the special meeting. Please be prepared to provide identification, such 
as a
driver&#146;s license or passport, before being admitted to the special meeting.
If you hold your shares in &#147;street name,&#148; that is, if you hold your 
shares in a stock brokerage account or if your shares are held by a broker, you 
will need
to provide proof of ownership to be admitted to the special meeting. A brokerage
statement or letter from your broker proving ownership of the shares on the 
record date for the special meeting are examples of proof of ownership. To help 
Mines
Management plan for the special meeting, please indicate whether you expect to 
attend by responding affirmatively when prompted during Internet or telephone 
proxy submission or by marking the attendance box on your proxy card. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What constitutes a quorum at the special meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>The presence, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a 
majority of the voting power of the Mines Management common stock entitled to 
vote at the
special meeting shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. 
Abstentions and broker non-votes will be counted as present and entitled to vote
for purposes of establishing a quorum. A broker non-vote occurs when a broker 
that holds
shares on behalf of a &#147;street name&#148; stockholder returns a valid proxy 
card, but does not vote on a particular matter because it does not have 
discretionary authority to vote on that particular matter and has not received 
voting
instructions from the &#147;street name&#148; stockholder. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman"><B>Q: What should I do now in order to vote on the proposals being 
considered at the special
meeting? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>Mines Management stockholders as of the 
record date may vote by proxy by </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">completing, signing, dating and returning the 
enclosed proxy card in the accompanying pre-addressed postage paid envelope; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">accessing the Internet website specified on your 
proxy card; or </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">calling the toll-free number specified on your 
proxy card. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If you hold shares of Mines 
Management common
stock in &#147;street name,&#148; which means that your shares are held of 
record by a broker, please refer to the voting instruction form used by your 
broker to see how to vote your shares. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Additionally, you may also vote in person by attending the special 
meeting. If you plan to attend the special meeting and wish to vote in person, 
you will be
given a ballot at the special meeting. Please note, however, that if your shares
are held in &#147;street name&#148; and you wish to vote at the special meeting,
you must bring a proxy from the record holder of the shares authorizing you to 
vote at
the special meeting. Whether or not you plan to attend the special meeting, you 
should submit your proxy card or voting instruction form as described in this 
proxy statement/prospectus. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: If my shares are held in &#147;street name&#148; by my broker, 
will my broker automatically vote my shares for me? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A:</B> No. If you hold your shares in a stock brokerage account or
if your shares are held by a broker (that is, in &#147;street name&#148;), your 
broker
cannot vote your shares on any of the proposals to be considered at the special 
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
meeting as all such proposals are &#147;non-routine&#148; matters. You should 
instruct your broker as to how to vote your shares, following the directions 
from your broker provided to you. Please
check the voting form used by your broker. If you do not provide your broker 
with instructions, your shares of Mines Management common stock will not be 
voted on any proposal at the special meeting. Please note that you may not vote 
shares held in
&#147;street name&#148; by returning a proxy card directly to Mines Management 
or by voting in person at the special meeting unless you provide a legal proxy, 
which you must obtain from your broker. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What will happen if I abstain from voting or fail to vote? 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>Mines Management cannot complete the merger unless its 
stockholders approve and adopt the merger agreement and the transactions 
contemplated thereby.
Because approval and adoption is based on the affirmative vote of a majority of 
the votes cast by holders of Mines Management common stock present in person or 
represented by proxy at the special meeting and entitled to vote on the 
proposal,
assuming a quorum is present, a Mines Management stockholder&#146;s failure to 
vote or the failure of a Mines Management stockholder who holds his or her 
shares in &#147;street name&#148; through a broker to give voting instructions 
to such broker
will have no effect on the merger proposal, assuming a quorum is present. If a 
Mines Management stockholder marks his or her proxy or provides voting 
instructions to abstain, it will have no effect on the merger proposal, assuming
a quorum is
present. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What will happen if I sign my proxy without 
specifying my voting preference? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>If you submit a signed proxy without specifying the manner 
in which you would like your shares to be voted, your shares will be voted 
&#147;FOR&#148;
the merger proposal, &#147;FOR&#148; the adjournment proposal and 
&#147;FOR&#148; the compensation proposal. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Can I 
change my vote after I have
delivered my proxy? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: </B>Yes. You can change your vote 
at any time before your proxy is voted at the special meeting. If you are a 
holder of
record, you can do this in one of three ways: </P> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">you can send a signed notice of revocation; 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">you can grant a new, valid proxy bearing a later 
date (including by telephone or through the Internet); or </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">you can attend the special meeting and vote in 
person, which will revoke any proxy previously given, or you may revoke your 
proxy in person, but your attendance alone will not revoke any proxy that you 
have previously
given. If you provide a written notice of revocation, you must submit it to the 
Corporate Secretary of Mines Management no later than the beginning of the 
special meeting. If you grant a new proxy by telephone or Internet voting, your 
revised
instructions must be received by 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time on September 11, 2016. 
If your shares are held in &#147;street name&#148; by your broker, you should 
contact your broker to change your vote or revoke your proxy. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What happens if I transfer my shares of Mines Management stock 
before the special meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>The record date for the special meeting is earlier than 
both the date of the special meeting and the date that the merger is expected to
be
completed. If you transfer your Mines Management shares after the record date 
for the special meeting, you will retain your right to vote at the special 
meeting, but you will have transferred the right to receive the merger 
consideration in the
merger. In order to receive the merger consideration, you must hold your shares 
through the effective time of the merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What 
should I do if I
receive more than one set of voting materials for the special meeting? </B></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>A: </B>You may receive more than one set of voting materials for 
the special
meeting, including multiple copies of this proxy statement/prospectus and 
multiple proxy cards or voting instruction forms. For example, if you hold </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">6 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
your shares in more than one brokerage account, you will receive a separate 
voting instruction form for each brokerage account in which you hold shares. If 
you are a holder of record and your
shares are registered in more than one name, you will receive more than one 
proxy card. For each and every proxy card and voting instruction form that you 
receive, please vote as soon as possible by completing, signing, dating and 
returning the
enclosed proxy card in the postage-prepaid envelope enclosed for that purpose or
by accessing the Internet website or by calling the toll-free number specified 
on your proxy cards. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Who can help answer my questions? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A: 
</B>If you
have any questions about the merger or the merger agreement or how to submit 
your proxy, or if you need additional copies of this proxy statement/prospectus 
or the enclosed proxy card or voting instructions, you should contact: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-

<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:2.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management, 
Inc.</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:2.00em; font-size:10pt;
font-family:Times New Roman">Investor Relations</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><A NAME="toc206461_2"></A>CAUTIONARY STATEMENT 
REGARDING FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">This proxy statement/prospectus and the information
incorporated by reference herein contains numerous forward-looking statements 
within the
meaning of Section&nbsp;27A of the Securities Act and Section&nbsp;21E of the 
Exchange Act, including statements relating to the financial condition, results 
of operations, business strategies, operating efficiencies or synergies, 
projected
timetable, expected tax treatment of the transaction, competitive positions, 
growth opportunities, plans and objectives of the management of each of Hecla 
and Mines Management, the merger and other transactions contemplated by the 
merger agreement,
the markets for Hecla and Mines Management common stock and other matters. Such 
forward-looking statements may be identified by the use of words such as 
&#147;believes,&#148; &#147;intends,&#148; &#147;expects,&#148; 
&#147;hopes,&#148;
&#147;may,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;will,&#148; &#147;plan,&#148; 
&#147;projected,&#148; &#147;contemplates,&#148; &#147;anticipates&#148; or 
similar words. Such forward-looking statements involve known and unknown risks, 
uncertainties and
other factors which may cause actual results, performance or achievements to be 
materially different from any future results, performance or achievements 
expressed or implied by the forward-looking statements. The factors that could 
cause actual
results to differ materially from those projected in the forward-looking 
statements include but are not limited to: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-
top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

and other

<div style ="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid 
#000000;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid 
#000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0px;MARGIN-RIGHT:0px;WIDTH:100%"><div style="width:97%; 
margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><A NAME="toc206461_3"></A>SUMMARY </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I>This summary highlights selected information 
from this proxy statement/prospectus. You are urged to read carefully the entire
proxy
statement/prospectus and the other documents referred to in this proxy 
statement/prospectus because the information in this section does not provide
all of the information that might be important to you with respect to the merger
agreement, the
merger and the other matters being considered at the special meeting. See 
&#147;Where You Can Find More Information&#148; beginning on page 108. Each item
in this summary refers to the page of this proxy statement/prospectus on which 
that subject is
discussed in more detail. </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt;
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_4"></A>The 
Parties (See page 35) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Hecla. </I>Hecla Mining Company is a Delaware 
corporation with its shares of common stock traded on the NYSE under the symbol
&#147;HL.&#148; Hecla is a U.S.-based precious and base metals mining company 
engaged in the exploration, acquisition, development, production and marketing 
of silver, gold, lead and zinc. In business since 1891, Hecla is among the 
oldest U.S.-based
precious metals mining companies. Hecla produces both metal concentrates, which 
it sells to smelters, and unrefined gold and silver bullion bars (dor&eacute;), 
which is either sold as dor&eacute; or refined before sale to precious metals 
traders.
Hecla&#146;s executive offices are located at 6500 N. Mineral Drive, Suite 200, 
Coeur d&#146;Alene, Idaho 83815-9408, and its telephone number is (208) 769-
4100. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Merger Sub. </I>HL Idaho Corp. is an Idaho 
corporation and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla. Upon completion of the 
merger, Merger Sub
will be merged with and into Mines Management, with Mines Management surviving 
as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla. Merger Sub has not conducted any 
significant activities other than those incidental to its formation and the 
matters contemplated
by the merger agreement in connection with the merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I>Mines Management. </I>Mines Management, Inc. is engaged in the 
business of
acquiring and exploring, and if exploration is successful, developing, mineral 
properties, primarily those containing silver and associated base and precious 
metals. Mines Management was incorporated under the laws of the State of Idaho 
on
February&nbsp;20, 1947. Mines Management&#146;s principal mineral property 
interest, the Montanore Project, is held by its wholly-owned subsidiaries, 
Newhi,&nbsp;Inc. and Montanore Minerals Corp. Mines Management&#146;s 
properties, including the
Montanore Project, are currently in the exploration stage; none of its 
properties are currently in production. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The 
Montanore Project is
located in northwestern Montana and from 1988 to 2002 was owned by Noranda 
Minerals Corporation (&#147;Noranda&#148;). During that time the project 
received an approved Environmental Impact Statement (&#147;EIS&#148;), Record of
Decision
(&#147;ROD&#148;) and all of its primary environmental permits, and conducted 
pre-evaluation construction activities on the property. From 1988 to 2002, Mines
Management held royalty rights to a portion of the deposit. In 2002, Noranda 
announced
that it was abandoning the project, and subsequently transferred to Mines 
Management by quitclaim deed the patented and unpatented mining claims that 
control the mineral rights, and all drill core and intellectual property 
including geologic,
environmental and engineering studies, relating to the Montanore Project. </P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">If the merger described in this proxy 
statement/prospectus is
not consummated, Mines Management will be required to seek additional capital or
consider other alternatives, which could include liquidating some or all of its 
assets in order to fund its liquidity requirements. Bankruptcy is also a 
possibility.
There is no assurance Mines Management&#146;s financing efforts would be 
successful under current market conditions. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">Mines Management
common stock is currently listed for trading on the NYSE MKT under the symbol 
&#147;MGN&#148; and the TSX under the symbol &#147;MGT.&#148; </P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br 
clear="All"></div><br clear="All">
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">11 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<div style ="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid 
#000000;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid 
#000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0px;MARGIN-RIGHT:0px;WIDTH:100%"><div style="width:97%; 
margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management&#146;s executive offices and 
principal place of business are located at 905
West Riverside Avenue, Suite 311, Spokane, Washington 99201, and its telephone 
number is (509) 838-6050. Mines Management&#146;s registered agent in Idaho is 
located at 921 S. Orchard St., Suite G, Boise, Idaho 83705. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Additional information about Mines Management and 
its subsidiaries is set forth under &#147;Information Regarding Mines 
Management&#148;
beginning on page 97. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_5"></A>The Merger 
(See page 68) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Subject to the terms and conditions of the merger 
agreement and in accordance with Idaho law, the merger agreement provides for 
the merger of
Merger Sub with and into Mines Management. Mines Management will survive the 
merger and become a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hecla. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A 
NAME="toc206461_6">
</A>Merger Consideration (See page 68) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">The merger agreement provides that, at the effective time, each share of 
Mines Management
common stock issued and outstanding or deemed issued and outstanding as of 
immediately prior to the effective time (excluding shares of Mines Management 
common stock that are owned immediately prior to the effective time by Mines 
Management, Hecla,
Merger Sub or any of their respective subsidiaries, which will be cancelled and 
cease to exist) will be converted into the right to receive 0.2218 of a share of
Hecla common stock. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_7"></A>Treatment of Options and Warrants (See 
page 69) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Stock Options</I></B>. At the effective time,
each option to purchase shares of Mines Management<B> </B>common stock that is 
outstanding
immediately prior to the effective time that has an exercise price per share 
greater than or equal to the product of the closing price of Hecla common stock 
on the NYSE on the trading day immediately preceding the closing date and 0.2218
will be
cancelled without any payment being made in respect thereof. At the effective 
time, each other option to purchase shares of Mines Management common stock that
is outstanding immediately prior to the effective time (all of which are vested)
will be
cancelled in exchange for the right to receive shares of Hecla common stock 
(without interest, and subject to deduction for any required withholding tax, 
with cash being paid in lieu of issuing fractional shares of Hecla common stock)
with a value
equal to (i)(a) the product of the closing price of Hecla common stock on the 
NYSE on the trading day immediately preceding the closing date and 0.2218 minus 
(b) the exercise price per share under such option multiplied by (ii) the number
of shares
subject to such option. At the option of Hecla, in lieu of paying all or a 
portion of the amounts due to a holder of options, Hecla may substitute for such
shares an equivalent amount in cash.<B><I>&nbsp;</I></B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Warrants</I></B>. At the effective time, and 
in accordance with the terms of any warrant to purchase shares of Mines 
Management<B>
</B>common stock that is outstanding immediately prior to the effective time, 
such warrant will either be cancelled in accordance with its terms or a 
replacement warrant will be issued giving the holder the right to purchase a 
number of shares of
Hecla common stock (without interest, and subject to deduction for any required 
withholding tax, and no issuance of fractional shares and the number of such 
shares rounded down) equal to the product of (i)&nbsp;0.2218 and (ii)&nbsp;the 
number of
shares of Mines Management<B> </B>common stock<B> </B>subject to such warrant, 
with an exercise price of $4.8765 per share of Hecla common stock, pursuant to 
and in accordance with such holder&#146;s warrants (as amended). </P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br 
clear="All"></div><br clear="All">
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">12 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<div style ="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid 
#000000;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid 
#000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0px;MARGIN-RIGHT:0px;WIDTH:100%"><div style="width:97%; 
margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_8"></A>The Special Meeting; Stockholders 
Entitled to Vote; Required Vote (See page 37)
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Meeting</I></B>. The special 
meeting will be held at the Lincoln Building, 811 W. Riverside, 2<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">nd</SUP> floor conference room, 
Spokane, Washington 99201 on Monday, September 12, 2016, at 2:00 p.m., local 
time. At the special meeting, Mines Management stockholders will be asked to 
vote on the following
proposals: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Merger proposal: To approve and adopt the merger 
agreement, a copy of which is attached as Appendix A to this proxy 
statement/prospectus, and the transactions contemplated thereby; 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Adjournment proposal: To approve the adjournment 
of the special meeting, if necessary to solicit additional proxies if there are 
not sufficient votes to approve and adopt the merger agreement at the time of 
the special
meeting; and </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Compensation proposal: To approve, on an advisory 
(non-binding) basis, the payments that will or may be paid by Mines Management 
to its named executive officers in connection with the merger. 
</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Stockholders Entitled to Vote</I></B>. Only 
Mines Management stockholders of record at the close of business on July 5, 2016
will be
entitled to receive notice of and to vote at the special meeting. As of the 
close of business on the record date of July 5, 2016, there were 35,857,893 
shares of Mines Management common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the 
meeting. Each
holder of Mines Management common stock is entitled to one vote for each share 
of common stock owned as of the record date. As of the close of business on the 
record date of July 5, 2016, Mines Management&#146;s directors and executive 
officers had
the right to vote approximately 2,904,318 shares of the then-outstanding Mines 
Management common stock at the special meeting, collectively representing 
approximately 8.1% of Mines Management common stock outstanding and entitled to 
vote at the
special meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Required 
Vote</I></B>. To approve and adopt the merger agreement and the transactions 
contemplated thereby, a
majority of the votes cast by holders of Mines Management common stock present 
in person or represented by proxy at the special meeting and entitled to vote on
the proposal must vote in favor of the proposal, and a quorum must be present at
the
special meeting. A Mines Management stockholder&#146;s failure to vote will have
no effect on the merger proposal, assuming a quorum is present. If you are a 
Mines Management stockholder and you mark your proxy or voting instructions to 
abstain, it
will have no effect on this proposal, assuming a quorum is present. </P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">To approve the adjournment of the special meeting, if 
necessary to
solicit additional proxies if there are not sufficient votes to approve and 
adopt the merger agreement at the special meeting, a majority of the votes cast 
by holders of Mines Management common stock present in person or represented by 
proxy at the
special meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal must vote in favor of the 
proposal, and a quorum must be present at the special meeting. A Mines 
Management stockholder&#146;s failure to vote will have no effect on the 
adjournment proposal,
assuming a quorum is present. If you are a Mines Management stockholder and you 
mark your proxy or voting instructions to abstain, it will have no effect on 
this proposal, assuming a quorum is present. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">To approve, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, the
payments that will or may be paid by Mines Management to its named executive 
officers in
connection with the merger, a majority of the votes cast by holders of Mines 
Management common stock present in person or represented by proxy at the special
meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal must vote in favor of the proposal,
and a
quorum must be present at the special meeting. A Mines Management 
stockholder&#146;s failure to vote will have no effect on the advisory vote, 
assuming a quorum is present. If you are a Mines Management stockholder and you 
mark your proxy or voting
instructions to abstain, it will have no effect on this proposal, assuming a 
quorum is present. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A 
NAME="toc206461_9"></A>Shareholders Agreements (See
page 67) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In connection with the merger 
agreement, Hecla entered into shareholders agreements with Silver Wheaton Corp.,
a stockholder
of Mines Management, and the following directors and officers of Mines 
Management: </P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br 
clear="All"></div><br clear="All">
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">13 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<div style ="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid 
#000000;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid 
#000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0px;MARGIN-RIGHT:0px;WIDTH:100%"><div style="width:97%; 
margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
Glenn Dobbs, Douglas Dobbs, Nicole Altenburg, Russell Babcock, Roy Franklin and 
Robert Russell. In the shareholders agreements, each of these stockholders has 
agreed to vote his, her, or its
shares of Mines Management common stock (as set forth in such shareholder&#146;s
shareholders agreement) in favor of approval and adoption of the merger 
agreement. As of the date of this proxy statement/prospectus, there were 
6,562,199 shares of
Mines Management common stock (which include 1,322,621 shares of Mines
Management common stock subject to currently exercisable options) subject to the
shareholders agreements, which represent approximately 17.6% of the outstanding 
shares of Mines
Management common stock as of that date. No separate consideration was provided 
to any of the stockholders who are parties to the shareholders agreements in 
order to induce them to enter into the shareholders agreements. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_10"></A>No Dissenters&#146; or Appraisal Rights
(See page 96) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Under Idaho law, holders of Mines Management common
stock will not be entitled to dissenters&#146; or appraisal rights. Therefore, 
holders of
Mines Management common stock as of the record date that are against the merger 
may vote against approval and adoption of the merger agreement but may not 
exercise dissenters&#146; or appraisal rights. See &#147;No Appraisal 
Rights&#148; beginning
on page&nbsp;96. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_11"></A>Regulatory
Matters (See page 64) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Neither Mines Management nor Hecla is required to 
obtain any approvals from any federal or state regulatory authorities to 
consummate the
merger. Hecla must comply with applicable federal and state securities laws and 
NYSE rules and regulations in connection with the issuance of shares of Hecla 
common stock in connection with the merger, including the filing with the SEC of
the
registration statement of which this proxy statement/prospectus is a part. In 
addition, the parties will be required to file a statement of merger with the 
Secretary of State of Idaho in order to effectuate the merger. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_12"></A>Recommendation of Mines 
Management&#146;s Board of Directors and Their Reasons for the Merger (See 
page&nbsp;48) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">After careful consideration, the Mines Management 
board of directors, on May 21, 2016, unanimously approved, adopted and declared 
advisable the
merger agreement and the merger, directed that the merger agreement be submitted
to the stockholders of Mines Management for approval and adoption and determined
that the terms of the merger agreement and the merger are advisable and in the 
best
interests of Mines Management&#146;s stockholders. For the factors considered by
the Mines Management board of directors in reaching its decision to approve and 
adopt the merger agreement, see the section entitled &#147;Proposal 1: The 
Approval and
Adoption of the Merger Agreement&#151;Recommendation of Mines Management&#146;s 
Board of Directors; Mines Management&#146;s Reasons for the Merger&#148; 
beginning on page&nbsp;48. <B>The </B><B>Mines Management</B> <B>board of 
directors unanimously
recommends that the </B><B>Mines Management stockholders</B><B> vote 
</B><B>&#147;</B><B>FOR</B><B>&#148;</B><B> each of the merger proposal, the 
adjournment proposal and the compensation proposal</B><B>.</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_13"></A>Opinion of the Financial Advisor to 
Mines Management&#146;s Board of Directors (See page 51) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">In connection with the transaction, Canaccord 
Genuity Corp. (&#147;CG&#148;), Mines Management&#146;s financial advisor, 
delivered its opinion
as of May 21, 2016 to the Mines Management board of directors, which was 
subsequently confirmed in writing, as to the fairness, from a financial point of
view, to the Mines Management common stockholders of the consideration to be
received by such
holders pursuant to the merger agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">The full text of the written opinion of CG is included in this document 
as Appendix B. You
should read the opinion carefully in its entirety for a description of the 
assumptions made, matters considered and limitations on the review undertaken by
CG. The opinion of CG was provided for the information and assistance of the 
Mines
</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br 
clear="All"></div><br clear="All">
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">14 </P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

Management board of directors in connection with its consideration of the 
transaction. The opinion of CG is not a recommendation as to how any stockholder
should vote or as to any action that a
stockholder should take with respect to the transaction. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A 
NAME="toc206461_14"></A>Hecla Stockholder Approval is Not Required (See page 41)
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Hecla stockholders are not required to adopt the 
merger agreement or approve the merger or the issuance of Hecla common stock in 
connection
with the merger. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_15"></A>Ownership 
of Hecla After the Merger (See page 41) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Hecla will issue approximately 9,024,790 shares of 
Hecla common stock to former Mines Management stockholders pursuant to the 
merger. Based on
the number of shares of Hecla common stock outstanding as of the date of this 
proxy statement/prospectus, immediately following the completion of the merger, 
Hecla expects to have approximately <B></B>395,477,900 shares of common stock 
outstanding.
Mines Management stockholders are therefore expected to hold approximately 
<B></B>2.28% of the aggregate number of shares of Hecla common stock outstanding
immediately after the merger. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_16"></A>Interests of Directors and Officers of 
Mines Management in the Merger (See page 60) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management&#146;s directors and officers have
financial interests in the merger that are different from, or in addition to, 
the interests
of Mines Management stockholders generally. The members of Mines 
Management&#146;s board of directors were aware of and considered these
interests, among other matters, in evaluating and negotiating the merger 
agreement and the merger, and in
recommending to Mines Management&#146;s stockholders that the merger agreement 
be approved and adopted. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">These interests 
include: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Certain officers of Mines Management may receive 
payments in connection with the merger pursuant to employment agreements with 
Mines Management. Assuming that the closing of the merger had occurred on July 
27, 2016, and
the employment of each of the officers of Mines Management was terminated 
immediately following the merger, they would be entitled to receive the 
following aggregate payment amounts: Glenn Dobbs&#151;$1,116,275; Douglas 
Dobbs&#151;$718,275; and
Nicole&nbsp;Altenburg&#151;$228,275. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The directors and officers of Mines Management are
entitled to continued indemnification and insurance coverage under the merger 
agreement after the effective time. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_17"></A>Material U.S. Federal Income Tax 
Consequences of the Merger (See page 62) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management is not expected to recognize any 
gain or loss for U.S. federal income tax purposes as a result of the merger. 
Mines Management
stockholders that are U.S. holders are not expected to recognize any gain or 
loss for U.S. federal income tax purposes upon the merger, except for any gain 
or loss attributable to the receipt of cash in lieu of fractional shares of 
Hecla common
stock received in the merger. The aggregate tax basis of the Hecla common stock 
received in the merger (including fractional shares deemed received and 
redeemed) will be equal to the aggregate adjusted tax basis of the shares of 
Mines Management
common stock surrendered for the Hecla common stock, and the holding period of 
the Hecla common stock (including fractional shares deemed received and 
redeemed) will include the period during which the shares of Mines Management 
common stock were
held. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management has received the 
opinion of Davis Graham &amp; Stubbs LLP that the merger will qualify as a tax-
free
reorganization described in Section 368 of the Code. You are encouraged to read 
the opinion, which is </P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br 
clear="All"></div><br clear="All">
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">15 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

section entitled &#147;Proposal 1: The Approval and Adoption of the Merger

and foreign
tax laws. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_18"></A>Accounting Treatment 
of the Merger (See page 64) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">In accordance with GAAP, Hecla will account for the
merger using the acquisition method of accounting for business combinations. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_19"></A>Certain Differences in the Rights of 
Stockholders (See page 87) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Mines Management stockholders will own shares of 
Hecla common stock following the completion of the merger, and their rights 
associated with
those shares of Hecla common stock will be governed by Hecla&#146;s certificate 
of incorporation and bylaws, which differ in a number of respects from the Mines
Management&#146;s articles of incorporation and bylaws. In addition, Mines 
Management is
an Idaho corporation, while Hecla is a Delaware corporation, and the rights of 
stockholders of Delaware corporations differ in certain respects from those of 
stockholders of Idaho corporations. See &#147;Comparative Rights of Hecla 
Stockholders and
Mines Management Stockholders&#148; beginning on page 87. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><A 
NAME="toc206461_20"></A>Conditions to Completion of the Merger (See page 79) 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Hecla and Mines Management currently expect to 
complete the merger in the third quarter of 2016, subject to receipt of required
Mines
Management stockholder approval and adoption and to the satisfaction or waiver 
of the other conditions to the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement
described below. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">As more fully described in this proxy 
statement/prospectus, each party&#146;s obligation to complete the transactions 
contemplated by the
merger agreement depends on a number of customary closing conditions being 
satisfied or, where legally permissible, waived, including, without limitation, 
the following: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>

contemplated thereby must have been approved and adopted by the affirmative vote
of at least a majority of the votes cast by holders of Mines Management common 
stock present in
person or represented by proxy at the special meeting, and a quorum must be 
present at the special meeting; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-

<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Mines Management being in compliance with the 
provisions of the Term Loan and Security Agreement, dated May 23, 2016, as 
amended on July 29, 2016, by and among Mines Management, certain of its 
subsidiaries and Hecla
(the &#147;Interim Credit Agreement&#148;); </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">each of the directors and officers of Mines 
Management having submitted their resignation from all such director and officer
positions held with Mines Management or its subsidiaries; and </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">the dissolution of Minera Montanore Peru S.A.C., a
subsidiary of Mines Management. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">The
obligation of Mines Management to effect the merger is subject to the 
satisfaction or waiver of the following additional conditions: </P> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">the representations and warranties of Hecla and 
Merger Sub in the merger agreement being true and correct both when made and at 
and as of the date of the closing of the merger, subject to certain standards, 
including
materiality and material adverse effect qualifications; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

complied in all material respects with all material agreements and covenants 
required by the merger agreement to be performed or complied with by Hecla 
and/or Merger Sub, as
applicable; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">since the date of the merger agreement, there
shall not have been any material adverse effect or any event, change or effect 
that would, individually or in the aggregate, reasonably be expected to have a 
material
adverse effect; and </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-
top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Mines Management shall have received a certificate
of an officer of Hecla confirming the satisfaction of the three preceding 
conditions. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B><A NAME="toc206461_21"></A>Termination of the Merger Agreement 
(See page 80) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Hecla or Mines Management may terminate the merger 
agreement at any time prior to the effective time: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">by mutual written consent of Hecla and Mines 
Management; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">by either Hecla or Mines Management: 
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>

approve and adopt the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby
at Mines Management&#146;s special stockholders&#146; meeting or any adjournment
or
postponement thereof at which approval and adoption of the merger agreement is

or the
failure by any party to perform any of its obligations under the merger 
agreement has been the cause of, or resulted in, the failure of the merger and

<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P
